0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Dandruff: shampoo scalp twice weekly
  • Seborrheic dermatitis of scalp: shampoo scalp twice weekly

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and effectiveness have not been established

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• avoid contact with eyes
  • pregnancy
  • sensitivity to hydroxyquinolines or edetate disodium

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Dermatologic:Contact dermatitis, Rash, Dry scalp, Hair discoloration, Scalp itchy
  • Other:Burning sensation, Irritation symptom, Local

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono:
• Topical: Although the mechanism of action is not understood, chloroxine may slow down mitotic activity in the epidermis, thereby reducing excessive scaling associated with dandruff or seborrheic dermatitis of the scalp.
  • Chloroxine has an antibacterial action, inhibiting the growth of gram-positive as well as some gram-negative organisms.
  • Also, chloroxine has shown some antifungal activity against certain dermatophytes and yeasts.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Topical
  • shake well before using
  • do not use on acutely inflamed (exudative) scalp lesions
  • massage onto wet scalp, lather should remain on scalp for at least 3 minutes; rinse, repeat once

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• improved seborrhea
  • reduced excess scaling in patients with dandruff

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause contact dermatitis, dry or itchy scalp, hair discoloration, irritation, or a burning sensation.
  • Patient should not use topical solution on acutely inflamed or exudative scalp lesions.
  • Instruct patient to avoid drug contact with eyes.
